intro: Rhanterium squarrosum, commonly known as the rough rhanterium, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and narrow, often hairy leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters, and bloom from late spring to early autumn. Rhanterium squarrosum is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
